com.cyc.query

Class Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cyc.query.Query
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InferenceParameterGetter, InferenceParameterSetter, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class Query
extends Object
implements Closeable, InferenceParameterSetter, InferenceParameterGetter
    Query is designed to represent queries posed to Cyc and provide access to their results.

    In general, the process of getting an answer from Cyc is:

    1. Create a Query object and set relevant fields on it.
    2. Access the answers via methods like getAnswersCyc(), getResultSet(), or by adding a listener via addListener(com.cyc.query.QueryListener) and starting the query via performInference().
    3. To avoid filling up memory on the Cyc server, close() the Query when you are done with it, which will free up any lingering associated inference resources on the Cyc image. Queries are also closed when their finalize() method is invoked, notably when they are garbage collected.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Query.Category
      A class for categorizing queries.
      class  Query.QueryResultSet
      An extension of KBInferenceResultSet that also provides an Iterable.iterator() method for QueryAnswer objects.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Query

        public Query(String queryStr)
      throws QueryConstructionException
        constructs a Query working with the string queryStr.

        The query is executed in InferencePSC with a default timeout and default inference parameters.

        Parameters:
        queryStr - the string representing the CycL query
        Throws:
        QueryConstructionException
        See Also:
        TIMEOUT

      • Query

        public Query(String queryStr,
     String ctxStr)
      throws QueryConstructionException
        Returns a query object defined by queryStr asked in Microtheory ctxStr, with default inference parameters.
        Parameters:
        queryStr - The query string.
        ctxStr - The Microtheory where the query is asked.
        Throws:
        QueryConstructionException

      • Query

        public Query(String queryStr,
     String ctxStr,
     String queryParams)
      throws QueryConstructionException
        Returns a query object defined by queryStr asked in Microtheory ctxStr, with inference parameters, queryParams.
        Parameters:
        queryStr - The query string.
        ctxStr - The Microtheory where the query is asked.
        queryParams - The inference parameters to use for the query. This string should consist of a series of keywords followed by the values for those keywords. The keywords can be found by looking for the #$sublIdentifier for the desired instance of InferenceParameter in the Cyc KB. For example, to limit a query to single-depth transformation and to allow at most 5 seconds per query, use the string ":max-transformation-depth 1 :max-time 5".
        Throws:
        QueryConstructionException

      • Query

        public Query(DenotationalTerm id)
      throws QueryConstructionException,
             KBApiException
        Deprecated. New code should use Query(com.cyc.kb.KBIndividual).
        Constructs a Query from a CycLQuerySpecification term.
        Parameters:
        id -
        Throws:
        QueryConstructionException
        KBApiException -

        Note: QueryConstructionException is thrown if the specified query term has a sentence whose outermost operator is #$ist and the query is loaded from a Cyc server with a system level under 10.154917 (Nov. 2014). A workaround is to edit the query in the KB, removing the #$ist from the query's sentence, and specifying it as the query mt using #$microtheoryParameterValueInSpecification.

      • Query

      throws QueryConstructionException,
             KBApiException

        QueryConstructionException
        KBApiException -

        Note: QueryConstructionException is thrown if the specified query term has a sentence whose outermost operator is #$ist and the query is loaded from a Cyc server with a system level under 10.154917 (Nov. 2014). A workaround is to edit the query in the KB, removing the #$ist from the query's sentence, and specifying it as the query mt using #$microtheoryParameterValueInSpecification.

      • load

        public static Query load(KBIndividual id)
                  throws QueryConstructionException,
                         KBApiException
        Returns a Query object defined by a query term (i.e. an instance of #$CycLQuerySpecification). Use of this method is equivalent to calling Query(com.cyc.kb.KBIndividual).
        Parameters:
        id - an instance of #$CycLQuerySpecification
        Returns:
        a Query object defined by queryTerm
        Throws:
        KBApiException - if there is a problem creating the Query object
        QueryConstructionException - if there is some other kind of problem

        Note: QueryConstructionException is thrown if the specified query term has a sentence whose outermost operator is #$ist and the query is loaded from a Cyc server with a system level under 10.154917 (Nov. 2014). A workaround is to edit the query in the KB, removing the #$ist from the query's sentence, and specifying it as the query mt using #$microtheoryParameterValueInSpecification.

        Returns a Query object defined by a CycLQuerySpecification term, and substitutes in relevant values from the indexicals Map. This is the equivalent of calling load(com.cyc.kb.KBIndividual) and then calling substituteTermsWithCycObject(java.util.Map) on it.
        Parameters:
        id - The instance of CycLQuerySpecification

        Exception -

A workaround is to edit the query in the KB, removing the #$ist from the query's sentence, and specifying it as the query mt using #$microtheoryParameterValueInSpecification.

        public static Query load(KBIndividual id,
         Map<KBObject,Object> indexicals)

        public static Query load(String idStr,
         Map<String,String> indexicals)
                  throws QueryConstructionException,
                         KBTypeException
        Returns a Query object defined by a CycLQuerySpecification term, and substitutes in relevant values from the indexicals Map.

      • registerRequiredSKSModules

        public void registerRequiredSKSModules()
        Ensure that any required Semantic Knowledge Source removal modules for this query have been registered on the Cyc Server and made available for inference.

        This should be done prior to running a query or set of queries that relies on real-time access to external knowledge sources.

        Required knowledge sources are noted in the KB using the predicate sksiModulesNeeded.

      • getQueryVariables

        public Collection<Variable> getQueryVariables()
                                       throws KBApiException
        Return a Collection of the variables in this query for which bindings are sought. Note that this is a copy of the variables, and modification of the returned value will not result in modifications of the underlying Query.
        Returns:
        a Collection of the variables in this query for which bindings are to be sought.
        Throws:
        KBApiException

      • continueQuery

        public void continueQuery()
        Continues the query. Can be used if a query has not been started yet, has stopped due to reaching the specified number of answers, or has used its alloted time or other resources and is continuable.

        Any resource constraints, e.g. time or number, get to "start over," so if the inference has already used its alloted 5 seconds, or found the specified three answers, continuing it will allow it to run for up to another 5 seconds, or until it finds up to another three answers.

        Returns when the inference has stopped running.

        See Also:
        setMaxNumber(Integer), setMaxTime(Integer), isContinuable(), setContinuable(boolean), InferenceWorker.continueInference(com.cyc.base.inference.InferenceParameters)

      • findRedundantClausesCFS

        @Deprecated
public Collection<Collection<FormulaSentence>> findRedundantClausesCFS()
                                                                throws CycConnectionException
        Deprecated. 
        Identifies redundant clauses in this query. For instance, if one clause isa (isa ?X Dog) and another is (isa ?X GreatDane), that pair is considered redundant. This method provides no guidance as to what can or should be done to resolve the redundancy, and in fact it may be virtually harmless, as Cyc can often solve such a query almost as efficiently as it can solve the more specific clause of the pair.
        Returns:
        a collection of pairs of any such clauses
        Throws:
        CycConnectionException

      • findRedundantClauses

        public Collection<Collection<Sentence>> findRedundantClauses()
                                                      throws KBApiException,
                                                             CycConnectionException
        Identifies redundant clauses in this query. For instance, if one clause isa (isa ?X Dog) and another is (isa ?X GreatDane), that pair is considered redundant. This method provides no guidance as to what can or should be done to resolve the redundancy, and in fact it may be virtually harmless, as Cyc can often solve such a query almost as efficiently as it can solve the more specific clause of the pair.
        Returns:
        a collection of pairs of any such clauses
        Throws:
        KBApiException
        CycConnectionException - if there is a problem communicating with Cyc.

      • findUnconnectedClauses

        public Collection<ArgPosition> findUnconnectedClauses()
                                               throws CycConnectionException
        Identifies unconnected clauses in this query. Generally, all clauses of a query will be connected by a chain of variables that connect them together. Queries with unconnected clauses are effectively separate queries, and running queries with disconnected clauses generally results in a cartesian product of the answer sets of the two separate queries.
        Returns:
        a collection of the arg positions of any such clauses
        Throws:
        CycConnectionException - if there is a problem communicating with Cyc.

      • merge

        public Query merge(Query otherQuery)
            throws QueryConstructionException,
                   CycConnectionException
        Conjoin this sentence with otherQuery, attempting to unify and rename variables. Typically, two different variables will unify into a single variable, causing all the uses of one of the variables to be renamed with the name of the other. In some cases, additional renaming may happen (e.g. if the queries contain mnemonic variables that become more tightly constrained as a result of the unification, a new mnemonic variable may be used in place of both of the original variables).
        Parameters:
        otherQuery -
        Returns:
        the new query
        Throws:
        CycConnectionException - if there was a problem connecting to Cyc.
        QueryConstructionException - if there was a problem constructing the new query.

        public Boolean isContinuable()

        Returns:
        true iff it can be continued.

      • setContinuable

        public InferenceParameterSetter setContinuable(boolean b)
        Specify whether inferences should be continuable. Continuable inferences are used e.g. when a maximum number of answers has been specified. The inference will be suspended after an initial batch of answers has been found, and continuing it may then yield the next batch.
        Specified by:
        setContinuable in interface InferenceParameterSetter
        Returns:
        this Query
        See Also:
        continueQuery()

      • setMaxNumber

        public InferenceParameterSetter setMaxNumber(Integer max)
        Set the maximum number of answers (or sets of answers) that Cyc will attempt to find for this Query. In some cases (such as when a set of answers is retrieved in a batch), more answers than this may actually be returned. Once this number of answers has been reached, Cyc will not actively look for additional answers.
        Specified by:
        setMaxNumber in interface InferenceParameterSetter
        Parameters:
        max -
        Returns:
        this Query
        See Also:
        InferenceParameterSetter.setMaxNumber(Integer)

        @Deprecated
public Query setQuerySentenceHypothesizedClause(CycFormulaSentence sentence)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the hypothesized clause of this Query. When the query is run, Cyc will assume that this clause is true. If the clause is independently known to be false in the query context, the query will be considered tautologous, and will fail.

      • clearResults

        public Query clearResults()
        Forget all results for this query. All settings on the Query are retained, including the query sentence, context, and inference parameters. After a Query has been cleared, it can be re-run, with possibly different results.
        Returns:
        this Query

      • isProvable

        public boolean isProvable()
        Is this query either True (if a boolean query) or does it have bindings (if non-boolean)
        Returns:
        True if there are bindings (or it's a true boolean query), false if there are no bindings (or it's a false boolean query).

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this query's result set, and releases resources on the Cyc server. See KBInferenceResultSet.close() for more details on what happens when a query is closed.

        It is good practice to always invoke this method explicitly as soon as a Query is no longer needed, as they can take up significant amounts of memory on the Cyc server.

        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        See Also:
        KBInferenceResultSet.close()

      • getCloseTimeout

        public long getCloseTimeout()
        Returns the timeout for the close() method.
        Returns:
        timeout in milliseconds

      • setCloseTimeout

        public void setCloseTimeout(long timeoutMS)
        Sets the timeout for the close() method.
        Parameters:
        timeoutMS - timeout in milliseconds

        the number of queries that were closed.

      • getResultSet

        public Query.QueryResultSet getResultSet()
        Returns:
        this query's result set. The KBInferenceResultSet is an object that may be updated dynamically for running queries. This contrasts with getAnswersCyc() which returns a static list of the answers at the time is was called.
